discoveries.finding: AccVid + CausVid combination significantly improves quality
discoveries.details: AccVid 1.5 strength + CausVid 0.5 strength with dpmpp_2m and sgm_uniform at 3 steps looks better than 8 steps with just CausVid

discoveries.finding: CausVid LoRA brings native and wrapper I2V outputs closer together
discoveries.details: Using CausVid reduces differences between native and wrapper implementations

discoveries.finding: Enhance feature helps with motion when using CausVid
discoveries.details: Enhance actually helps with motion quite a bit with causvid

discoveries.finding: HPS LoRA may be beneficial to add
discoveries.details: Adding HPS LoRA may not be a bad idea either

discoveries.finding: Phantom 14B shows much better results than 1.3B
discoveries.details: Movement is great as well as the colors and camera overall. way better than 1.3b

discoveries.finding: MPS Reward LoRA dramatically improves Wan video quality and details
discoveries.details: Using MPS (prompt adherence) reward LoRA with strength 1 alongside CausVid produces significant quality improvements - described as 'night and day' difference

discoveries.finding: Combining multiple LoRAs produces best results for low step workflows
discoveries.details: Best combo found: CausVid + AccVid (improves prompt adherence, movement, detail) + HLS (further improves prompt adherence and movement) at 3 steps

discoveries.finding: T2V LoRAs work with I2V models
discoveries.details: T2V LoRAs can be used with I2V models, I2V LoRAs work with T2V but perform worse

discoveries.finding: Any image LoRA trained at 1024 improves quality on any model
discoveries.details: Image-only LoRAs trained at 1024 resolution act as detailers and pull up quality when used on video models

discoveries.finding: Fun InP 1.3B is actually an image to video model
discoveries.details: Despite the name, it functions as I2V

discoveries.finding: Detail Transfer node can improve mouth movements with masking
discoveries.details: Using Detail Transfer node with mouth mask provides better lip sync results

discoveries.finding: Resolution mismatch causes VACE encoder stacking issues
discoveries.details: Different preprocessor output resolutions prevent normals and DW pose from working together

discoveries.finding: MoviiGen LoRA adds significant prompt adherence
discoveries.details: At strength 0.75, MoviiGen dramatically improves following detailed camera movement prompts

discoveries.finding: Wan-Toy-Transform LoRA converts things in images to fluffy JellyCat-style toys
discoveries.details: Trigger prompt: 'The video opens with a clear view of a $name. Then it transforms to a b6e9636 JellyCat-style $name. It has a face and a cute, fluffy and playful appearance.'

discoveries.finding: ATI trajectories can go out of frame and still work properly
discoveries.details: Trajectories extending beyond image boundaries are handled correctly by the model

discoveries.finding: Wan needs 121 points for 81 frames due to fps conversion
discoveries.details: Something to do with the expectation that you do the points in 24fps while the model is 16fps

discoveries.finding: VACE inpainting can work even without connecting masks
discoveries.details: Forgot to connect the masks for vace inpainting, and ran only with the gray mask input video. Somehow, it still worked.

discoveries.finding: Face area trimming and upscaling improves facial expressions
discoveries.details: Trim the face area and upscale to 720p, then pass into preprocessor and sampler. After that, downscale back to original size and stitch back into video

discoveries.finding: 540p model works on 360x640 resolution
discoveries.details: You just need to come in under the stated resolution for skyreels+vace

discoveries.finding: CausVid v2 at 10 steps performs significantly better than 5 steps
discoveries.details: Huge difference between 5 -> 10 steps, but 10 -> 15 steps isn't worth it

discoveries.finding: External pose detection works better than ComfyUI's DWPose
discoveries.details: DWPose in ComfyUI doesn't work as well as HuggingFace demos, sometimes spits out black frames

discoveries.finding: MPS LoRA at strength 2.0 removes flux face
discoveries.details: Testing showed MPS lora strength 2 removes flux face LOL

discoveries.finding: On-the-fly model merging using ModelMergeSimple node
discoveries.details: Can merge models without saving using ModelMergeSimple node, allows for dynamic testing

discoveries.finding: ATI trajectory editor now has official release
discoveries.details: Official editor uploaded with timeline support

discoveries.finding: ATI hardcoded to 121 frames in 24fps which corresponds to 81 frames in 16fps
discoveries.details: Original code limitation prevents using other frame counts

discoveries.finding: ATI solves motion almost on the first step
discoveries.details: Motion control is applied very early in the denoising process

discoveries.finding: Using 121 points in spline editor gives better results than 81 for ATI
discoveries.details: Despite 81 frame output, 121 trajectory points work better

discoveries.finding: Model makes things bright green when failing
discoveries.details: Green hue indicates generation problems or parameter conflicts

discoveries.finding: CausVid v1 consistently outperforms v1.5 and v2 for both I2V and T2V
discoveries.details: After 300 generations of testing

discoveries.finding: Wan can generate 81 frames at 2 steps looking better than 1 frame at 2 steps with image models
discoveries.details: Video model efficiency surprising at low step counts

discoveries.finding: Temperature and top_k values for ATI initially don't seem to do much
discoveries.details: May affect more with many trajectory points

discoveries.finding: VACE embed strength can be lowered to reduce color washout and jankiness across batch seams
discoveries.details: Using 70% strength with depth only reduces artifacts, especially where depth detection fails and areas approach black

discoveries.finding: Inverting colors in gaze control makes people get glasses
discoveries.details: Interesting side effect when using gaze control preprocessing

discoveries.finding: Different samplers affect quality significantly
discoveries.details: UniPC gives results in fewer steps but lower quality. DPM++ 2M/SGM_uniform and Euler provide better image quality but require more steps

discoveries.finding: GGUF models respond better to CausVid/AccVideo LoRAs
discoveries.details: GGUF format seems to work better with motion LoRAs for unknown reasons

discoveries.finding: GGUF LoRAs behave differently than regular LoRAs
discoveries.details: When using GGUF LoRAs are not merged into the main model, instead the weights are added during the dequant of the weights, that often makes LoRAs stronger... but also means that every LoRA you add slows it down a bit and uses more memory

discoveries.finding: AccVid I2V performance is step-dependent
discoveries.details: AccVid is heavily dependent on steps. AccVid works much better at a higher strength, increasing the motion, detail and prompt adherence greatly. At higher steps it will 'overcook' the video. Even raising the steps from 2 to 4 at a high accvid strength will overcook the colors quite a bit.

discoveries.finding: Sampler choice dramatically affects output quality
discoveries.details: Massive difference between euler and dpmpp_2. Euler has natural skin tone and better natural lighting. dpmpp_2 plus beta outputs very detailed bright video type.

discoveries.finding: SageAttention 2 provides huge performance improvements
discoveries.details: Minimum 30% speed improvement, can double speed at higher resolutions like 1024+, also reduces VRAM usage

discoveries.finding: CausVid 2-step workflow good for fast testing
discoveries.details: Fast objects are blurry at 2 steps, can bump to 3 steps for quick testing

discoveries.finding: Phantom model isn't flexible with other additions
discoveries.details: Adding anything to Phantom model makes it work worse, need to use lower strength if combining with CausVid

discoveries.finding: CFG above 1.0 causes extreme saturation in Native
discoveries.details: With Accvid, causvid 1/1.5, mps - output gets extremely saturated when CFG raised above 1.0

discoveries.finding: ATI works with CausVid
discoveries.details: CausVid works pretty great with ATI (Animated Track Interpolation)

discoveries.finding: TeaCache works with CausVid at lower thresholds
discoveries.details: TeaCache sort of works with CausVid, just not at as high threshold as without CausVid

discoveries.finding: FP32 VAE is worth using for single image encoding
discoveries.details: Better quality for encoding single images

discoveries.finding: AccVid strength increases motion by 50% per strength level
discoveries.details: AccVid at 4.00 has very dynamic motion, works best at 2-3 steps

discoveries.finding: CausVid takes away motion, AccVid adds motion
discoveries.details: They work well together as complementary tools

discoveries.finding: Higher AccVid strength works better on low steps
discoveries.details: The higher the steps, the more overcooked videos look with high AccVid

discoveries.finding: Vace conditionings are now stackable in ComfyUI native
discoveries.details: Recent commit allows stacking different Vace conditions

discoveries.finding: Raising causvid lora to 0.75 greatly increases motion when used with accvid at high strengths
discoveries.details: Also raising causvid strength seems to fix overcooked colors that high accvid strengths cause

discoveries.finding: Original causvid gives better results than V2 in some cases
discoveries.details: Looks better when ran with just wan though strange

discoveries.finding: LoRAs do load in Native workflow despite console errors
discoveries.details: Testing confirmed loras ARE actually loading regardless of what the console says

discoveries.finding: Prompt adherence is better with certain lora combinations
discoveries.details: The prompt had 'Kite' flying in background, so prompt adherence is better in the 2nd one

discoveries.finding: VRAM usage grows with pixel count - 1080p to 4k is like 16x pixels
discoveries.details: If able to gen 5s without issues in 720x720 with 12gb, should be able to do better on ggufs with better setups

discoveries.finding: 3 steps produces surprisingly good quality
discoveries.details: User achieved insane quality for 3 steps with specific settings, though some artifacts like weird carpet texture remain

discoveries.finding: Simple scheduler works best for low steps
discoveries.details: Testing shows simple scheduler outperforms beta, linear quadratic, and kl_optimal for 3-step generation

discoveries.finding: Q8 GGUF quality comparison
discoveries.details: Q8 GGUF is roughly equivalent to fp16 safetensors quality but half the size, significantly better than fp8

discoveries.finding: Seeds matter significantly for video generation
discoveries.details: Some seeds work fantastically well while others produce complete failures, contrary to typical randomness expectations

discoveries.finding: Phantom may prefer character positioning
discoveries.details: Testing suggests phantom performs better when characters are positioned optimally in the reference image

discoveries.finding: Reference image size in canvas affects dominance
discoveries.details: Parts of reference image that occupy more space in canvas dominate the outputs more

discoveries.finding: AccVid I2V LoRA is much better than T2V version
discoveries.details: Better resemblance retention, fixes overblown colors, greater prompt adherence, more fluid dynamic movement, more stable at higher strengths up to 4.0

discoveries.finding: CFG scheduling 4,3,2,1,1,1,1,1,1,1 is key to success
discoveries.details: This CFG scheduling is described as 'the whole secret of success' for workflows

discoveries.finding: Separating VACE encodes affects control strength
discoveries.details: Single VACE embed with start frame and control has stronger control than separating first frame into its own encode and control into its own

discoveries.finding: Reducing shift parameter helps with transition speed
discoveries.details: Reducing shift from 8 to 5 helped with how fast the model changes between frames

discoveries.finding: Blurring depth maps while increasing strength improves results
discoveries.details: Turned up strength of depth control but blurred it more to compensate for better results

discoveries.finding: Shift values significantly affect video generation results in merged models
discoveries.details: VRGameDevGirl84's merge performs best with shift=1-2, while standard Wan typically uses higher shift values around 5-14

discoveries.finding: Hair artifacts can be reduced with proper shift tuning
discoveries.details: Hair issues appear with higher shift values (8+) and can be minimized by finding optimal shift range for specific models

discoveries.finding: Step count affects minimum viable shift values
discoveries.details: 3 steps requires higher shift values, 4+ steps allows lower shift values. Formula suggested: steps*0.5 for safe shift value

discoveries.finding: GGUF vs FP16 may cause quality differences
discoveries.details: Hair artifacts may be related to using GGUF quantized models vs full precision FP16 weights

discoveries.finding: Detail transfer can be applied selectively using pose landmarks
discoveries.details: Mouth coordinates from MediaPipe/DWPose can be used to create tracking masks for selective detail enhancement

discoveries.finding: VACE inpainting requires mid-grey masks (127, 127, 127) not white masks
discoveries.details: Standard white masks don't work - need specific RGB value of 127, 127, 127 for proper inpainting

discoveries.finding: Multiple VACE encodes improve video quality
discoveries.details: Using separate VACE encodes for different controls at lower strengths improves video quality compared to combining controls

discoveries.finding: FP32 precision dramatically improves quality
discoveries.details: Using FP32 for VAE and T5 text encoder produces significantly better quality results than lower precision

discoveries.finding: Phantom ignores reference elements not mentioned in prompt
discoveries.details: Phantom is very specific about prompting and will ignore anything in reference images that isn't explicitly mentioned in the prompt

discoveries.finding: CausVid V2 needs higher strength settings for photorealistic content
discoveries.details: Phantom 14b with photorealistic content needs CausVid V2 lora strength around 2.0

discoveries.finding: Model dimensions must be divisible by 16
discoveries.details: The model has a hard requirement that dimensions must be divisible by 16, ComfyUI automatically adds pixels if not

discoveries.finding: 720p model significantly outperforms 480p model
discoveries.details: 720p model fixes realistic movement issues that 480p struggles with, even at lower resolutions. 480p gives slowed down fluid motion while 720p provides realistic dynamic movement

discoveries.finding: Even step counts work better than odd step counts with shift formula
discoveries.details: Formula 'steps * 0.5 - 0.25' works for even steps (4,6,8), but odd steps (3,5,7) need additional +8 and look worse with glitches

discoveries.finding: FP32 doubles inference time compared to FP16
discoveries.details: Running 1.3B model at FP32 was extremely slow, FP16 without quantization works better

discoveries.finding: 12 steps with Phantom and Causvid produces decent results
discoveries.details: Good quality output achieved with this combination

discoveries.finding: Flowmatch_Causvid scheduler disables shift settings
discoveries.details: According to gemini AI, using Flowmatch_Causvid basically disables shift parameter functionality

discoveries.finding: Custom sigmas work better with low shift than normal sigmas
discoveries.details: Custom sigmas with low shift provide better detail than normal sigmas with high shift (9.75)

discoveries.finding: Color shift occurs during video extension with Skyreels DF
discoveries.details: Heavy color shift happens when extending videos with Skyreels DF, can be fixed with color match node

discoveries.finding: DPM++ SDE Beta works best for Phantom
discoveries.details: Scheduler testing shows DPM++ SDE Beta performs best with Phantom model

discoveries.finding: Phantom reference adds a latent causing frame count mismatch
discoveries.details: When using Phantom with uni3c, phantom adds an extra latent causing tensor size mismatch (Expected size 11 but got size 9)

discoveries.finding: Wan wrapper strength value behaves like a blend percent between inpaint and original, not as reference image weighting
discoveries.details: User expected strength to weight reference image information but it acts more like a blend factor

discoveries.finding: Phantom wrapper batching multiple images doesn't work as expected initially
discoveries.details: Only first latent is accounted for, but lowering latent_strength to around 0.65 on each latent input helps with comprehending differences between people

discoveries.finding: VACE only processes the first reference frame when multiple are passed
discoveries.details: Code will just use the first frame even if batch of reference frames is sent

discoveries.finding: FP32 configuration significantly improves quality
discoveries.details: Configuring model in fp32 increases quality noticeably, especially at 720p, with less 'weird nose' artifacts and noise

discoveries.finding: CausVid V2 requires much higher strength settings
discoveries.details: V2 works much better with strength around 2.0, also 20-30% faster than previous versions

discoveries.finding: Native VACE is about 10 times quicker than KJ wrapper
discoveries.details: Performance difference observed during testing

discoveries.finding: Phantom can take up to 4 batched images
discoveries.details: Multiple encode nodes possible but effect wasn't great, causes blending rather than unique processing

discoveries.finding: VACE loses control on longer videos
discoveries.details: Works fine at 45 frames, starts losing at 85 frames, and for 161 frames does not follow anymore

discoveries.finding: Wan models work worse beyond 81 frames
discoveries.details: Anything beyond the 81 frames just works worse, except with models trained with more frames like skyreels

discoveries.finding: FP16_fast provides 20% speed boost
discoveries.details: Torch 2.7.0 provides about 20% speed boost for Wan in general with fp16_fast

discoveries.finding: VACE latents are actually empty
discoveries.details: Information is passed through conditioning pipes not latent ones, latent just needs to be same size

discoveries.finding: Self-forcing model from Adobe achieves 16 fps generation speed
discoveries.details: Takes ~5 seconds to do 81 frames on 4090 with 1.3B and 6 steps, equivalent to about 16 frames per second

discoveries.finding: Self-forcing works with VACE for I2V despite being T2V model
discoveries.details: 1.3B self-forcing model can work with VACE conditioning for image-to-video generation

discoveries.finding: Skip Layer Guidance can fix screen door artifacts
discoveries.details: Using SLG as a second pass V2V with low denoise can eliminate high-frequency detail artifacts

discoveries.finding: FP32 VAE only helps on encode, not decode
discoveries.details: FP32 VAE provides very slight quality improvement on encode only, never saw it do anything on decode

discoveries.finding: DPM++_SDE/Beta sampler reduces noise/screendoor effects
discoveries.details: Using DMP++_SDE sampler with 10 steps, CFG 1, Shift 2 for I2V with start/end frame reduces screendoor artifacts

discoveries.finding: Self-Forcing models have no 81 frame limit
discoveries.details: N0NSens confirmed that Self-Forcing models can generate beyond 81 frames without restrictions

discoveries.finding: Self-Forcing model is 6-7x faster than WAN + CausVid
discoveries.details: Jonathan reports 6-7x faster generation on 12GB card compared to already accelerated WAN with CausVid/AccVid

discoveries.finding: Self-Forcing generates frame sequentially/autoregressively
discoveries.details: MysteryShack explains it generates frames sequentially, depending on previous frame for next one, different from standard WAN parallel generation

discoveries.finding: LoRAs have more influence on Self-Forcing model
discoveries.details: Kaïros reports LoRAs seem to have stronger effect and produce consistent results across different sampler/scheduler combinations

discoveries.finding: Self-Forcing model has near-zero prompt adherence in I2V
discoveries.details: N0NSens demonstrates poor prompt following with spacesuit example using VACE I2V

discoveries.finding: CausVid kills motion, AccVid restores it
discoveries.details: Jonathan explains CausVid reduces movement while AccVid increases it, recommending AccVid at 1.5-2.0 strength

discoveries.finding: Lowering shift increases motion significantly
discoveries.details: Jonathan advises lowering shift parameter can greatly increase motion in generations

discoveries.finding: ProRes crushes blacks on Windows due to Mac gamma vs PC gamma difference
discoveries.details: Built for Mac gamma, causes black crushing on Windows systems

discoveries.finding: fp8_e4 doesn't work with compile, use fp8_e5 instead
discoveries.details: Compatibility issue with torch compile

discoveries.finding: Self-forcing model license is CC4 non-commercial share-alike
discoveries.details: Important licensing restriction for commercial use

discoveries.finding: Self-forcing training took only 2 hours with many H100s
discoveries.details: Suggests 14B version could potentially be trained in a day

discoveries.finding: VACE+Phantom merge requires tensor size matching
discoveries.details: Need to add 4 images to VACE conditioning for every Phantom image to match tensor sizes

discoveries.finding: Self-forcing achieves 16 fps on Wan 1.3B on H100
discoveries.details: Significant speed improvement for video generation

discoveries.finding: Wan DCM lora can be extracted and used separately from main model
discoveries.details: Even when used incorrectly, the extracted DCM lora shows significant improvement. They split training into 'semantics' (DCM lora for first few steps) and 'details' (rest of model)

discoveries.finding: Phantom model has better face consistency at 480p than 720p
discoveries.details: The Phantom-Wan-14B model was trained on 480p data, explaining better performance at that resolution

discoveries.finding: VACE can work with batched reference images for Phantom
discoveries.details: Users successfully using batched images as reference input for Phantom with VACE

discoveries.finding: AniWan Merge at 25% with OgWan works well for I2V
discoveries.details: Using AniWan Merge at 25% with OgWan 480p I2V, 2 Step Wan I2V Workflow, LiveWallpaper 480p Strng 0.25 + CausVid Strng 0.5 + Upscale with Deflicker workflow produces good results

discoveries.finding: Self-forcing model is very fast with acceptable results
discoveries.details: Works as low as 3-5 steps, 8 steps is best. Only works with 1.3b loras

discoveries.finding: Detail transfer helps maintain quality when upscaling
discoveries.details: Using detail transfer with upscaling workflows maintains fine details better than standard upscaling

discoveries.finding: NAG (Negative Augmented Generation) shows impressive results with Wan
discoveries.details: Initial test results show significant improvement, only added to crossattn so speed loss is negligible

discoveries.finding: Causal sampling running in realtime
discoveries.details: Wild seeing the video in realtime in the preview, does 3 latents at a time. Even works for T2V

discoveries.finding: Multiple VACE embeds work with proper setup
discoveries.details: Can use 2-3 VACE embeds simultaneously for different controls (depth, pose, ref image)

discoveries.finding: NAG (Normalized Attention Guidance) PR merged and working
discoveries.details: NAG PR is merged and can be used with Wan models, basically CFG distillation that adds motion and is nearly free computationally

discoveries.finding: MagCache performs similarly to TeaCache
discoveries.details: MagCache is almost exactly the same as TeaCache, requires 10x lower threshold values than defaults to work properly

discoveries.finding: Native/GGUF runs twice as fast as wrapper
discoveries.details: Same settings, not running out of VRAM anywhere, but native implementation is significantly faster

discoveries.finding: Wan adds padding frames for incompatible frame counts
discoveries.details: When using 100 frame video, it samples 101 frames but outputs 97, includes reference latents in sampling count

discoveries.finding: VACE precision doesn't matter much
discoveries.details: Higher precision VACE module gets quantized to same as main model anyway

discoveries.finding: NAG (Negative Attention Guidance) works with 1 CFG
discoveries.details: Allows negative prompting without regular CFG, can remove things from video without changing main composition or change details

discoveries.finding: CausVid sampling needs specific timesteps
discoveries.details: Playing with timesteps can break compatibility with other components

discoveries.finding: TeaCache doesn't work well with low steps
discoveries.details: At low steps, TeaCache doesn't provide meaningful improvement over just using fewer steps

discoveries.finding: Phantom considers colors, backgrounds, positions and scale from reference images
discoveries.details: Need to position references on 2D board roughly, avoid cropping ref image smaller than output

discoveries.finding: Phantom works better when merged with T2V model at 0.15-0.25 strength
discoveries.details: LoRAs work way better with this merge, pure Phantom often produces 'monstrosity' with LoRAs

discoveries.finding: NAG memory usage is minimal
discoveries.details: Max allocated memory increased from 16.915GB to 16.924GB, reserved from 18.156GB to 18.562GB

discoveries.finding: Cosmos Predict2 uses WAN VAE and architecture
discoveries.details: Config shows '_class_name': 'WanModel', same 14B size as WAN, likely finetune or same architecture trained from scratch

discoveries.finding: Self-forcing model is 5-6x faster than Wan 14B and works well with t2v, i2v, and vace
discoveries.details: After 500 tests, consistently faster performance with comparable quality to 14B model

discoveries.finding: Self-forcing model retains composition at 2 steps, allowing faster testing
discoveries.details: Unlike 14B model, can generate at 2 steps and retain composition for rapid testing of vace control, movement, and seeds

discoveries.finding: NAG keeps things more intact when pushing values compared to scheduled CFG
discoveries.details: More evident results and better timing control than scheduled CFG for initial steps

discoveries.finding: Camera movement can be controlled with simple splines on background in VACE
discoveries.details: Longer splines = faster movement, shorter = slower. Two splines in opposite directions create rotation. Size changes enable zoom in/out

discoveries.finding: Changing frame rate of control affects movement speed while keeping output frame rate
discoveries.details: Can speed up or slow down movement by adjusting control frame rate independently

discoveries.finding: Phantom has character LoRA bleeding solution
discoveries.details: Can put two different characters in one scene with no bleeding using reference (latent strength s > 1) and LoRA (strength S < s)

discoveries.finding: Torch compiler works with fp8_e5m2 setting
discoveries.details: Only works with this specific setting, not with default or fp8_e4m3f

discoveries.finding: Phantom may be trained on realistic images only
discoveries.details: Testing suggests it struggles with non-realistic inputs, explaining inconsistent performance

discoveries.finding: VACE with phantom produces better i2v results than standard 14B t2v/VACE
discoveries.details: Phantom/VACE combination shows much better face stability and detail, especially after first few frames

discoveries.finding: VACE can do i2v using just start image
discoveries.details: Use start to end frame node with just start image connected, acts like i2v

discoveries.finding: VACE is good at filling in motion from partial control
discoveries.details: Can provide just a few frames of control and VACE continues the motion for rest of video

discoveries.finding: FusionX with VACE produces high quality results
discoveries.details: CV VACE with fusion lora at 4 steps is faster and better than original i2v

discoveries.finding: Phantom allows up to 121 frames instead of 81
discoveries.details: Can generate longer videos at 24fps compared to standard i2v

discoveries.finding: Causal sampling does 3 latents at a time
discoveries.details: Can theoretically go endlessly, trained with 3 latents so struggles with normal 81 frame workflows that do 21 latents

discoveries.finding: Context options allow 241+ frame videos

discoveries.finding: FusionX is 90% CausVid with other loras merged
discoveries.details: The main performance boost comes from CausVid, with other loras providing additional quality improvements

discoveries.finding: NAG node provides massive improvement to prompt following and motion quality at 1 CFG
discoveries.details: New node that allows CFG-like results without the 2x generation time penalty

discoveries.finding: Skip layer guidance with 1.3B at 0.1 denoise does a nice job for cleanup
discoveries.details: Can be used to improve results from 14B generations

discoveries.finding: Reward loras from diffsynth are without alpha, so they are twice as strong
discoveries.details: Need to account for doubled strength when using these loras

discoveries.finding: Using FusionX as a lora with NAG and HPS at 0.4 gives CFG-like results without CFG
discoveries.details: Combination provides good results with noise_aug_strength

discoveries.finding: VACE can do image extension instead of pure i2v when used like t2v
discoveries.details: Acts more like text-to-video if reference image isn't properly plugged in

discoveries.finding: Tiled upscaling allows Full HD ultrawide generation on 4090
discoveries.details: 81 frames at 1920x544 using only 60% VRAM with Ultimate SD Upscale

discoveries.finding: NAG can be used in native ComfyUI with new NAG node from KJNodes
discoveries.details: Just plug it into the model and plug in the negative conditioning. ModelSamplingSD3 node can change shift in native

discoveries.finding: Self-forcing model uses shifted sigmas like 'warp' causvid
discoveries.details: Similar to the causvid warp functionality

discoveries.finding: Self-forcing model was trained very quickly
discoveries.details: Appears to have been done in just a few days

discoveries.finding: LightX2V/self-forcing LoRA doesn't have causvid motion issues
discoveries.details: Can use at full strength without first block issues that causvid has

discoveries.finding: LightX2V handles motion loras much better than CausVid or AccVid with half the cost
discoveries.details: Better performance with motion-specific loras

discoveries.finding: Context windows work by mixing clips during sampling
discoveries.details: All done at the same time, which is why start frame doesn't work well and it's slower and less consistent

discoveries.finding: ATI (I2V) with context windows is complicated due to init image handling
