comparisons.verdict: Video to video much faster for similar quality results
0.5 strength looks best, should try going even lower

comparisons.comparison: Audio gain 1 vs 2 vs 3 for MultiTalk
comparisons.verdict: 3 is best, 2 is good too, much better than default 1

comparisons.comparison: MultiTalk distill LoRA vs base MAGREF
comparisons.verdict: Distill LoRA (cfg 1, 4 steps) was better quality, faster, and same audio sync vs base (cfg 5, 20 steps). Distill took 5 minutes vs 40 minutes for base
LightX2V is much better than CausVid for WAN
Try Kijai's VAE if Comfy version gives garbled outputs

comparisons.comparison: Video Depth Anything vs regular depth
comparisons.verdict: Video Depth Anything is way better, especially with vitG model

comparisons.comparison: Normal maps vs depth maps for VACE
comparisons.verdict: Normal maps provide better adherence and sharper outputs without color bleeding
UltraWan 1K with self-forcing DMD VACE 1.3B allows higher resolutions on lower VRAM
Native with GGUF models produces superior results but has VRAM offloading issues
Q4_KM gives just as good results but faster, decided to always use Q4_KM
OG2 results feel like examples on repo are cherry picked, nowhere near Kontext quality
Results look pretty crap, movement is nice but focused more on final video quality

comparisons.comparison: Wan FusionX vs Flux for text-to-image
comparisons.verdict: Shows comparison images but no explicit verdict given
MagRef seems to be performing the best for character consistency
AnimateDiff is a predecessor to Wan and not directly connected - they don't work together despite some confusion
AnimateDiff being stuck at 16 frames was biggest flaw, Wan handles much longer sequences
Still prefer VACE and/or phantom, MagRef was a disappointment as it's only an image to video model

comparisons.comparison: Uni3C vs Wan for camera motion
comparisons.verdict: Uni3c is much better for style transfer, unlike control it's much 'softer' and really good for camera
New Wan Audio might be more general and flexible than MultiTalk, could be interesting for things other than speech

comparisons.comparison: Wan FP8 vs full model on 4090
comparisons.verdict: 30sec vs 143sec generation time, no noticeable quality difference, not worth the extra time
CausVid at 10 steps produces more cinematic realism than LightX at 4 steps for text-to-video
VACE 1.3 outperforms in quality despite both being slow
2B model much faster (under a minute vs hours), 13B higher quality but much slower
Fun models are poor man's VACE models. VACE can do everything Fun models do and more

comparisons.comparison: Full lightx2v VACE model vs 14b VACE with lora
comparisons.verdict: Full lightx2v VACE model performs better than just using 14b VACE with the lora
CausVid/AccVid/Reward loras still give better motion, but LightX2V is more stable
LightX2V outputs are remarkably stable, sometimes different seed doesn't change anything, but motion is muted
VACE now blows Cosmos out of the water
LightX is fast but not as good quality as CausVid v2. LightX gets worse with more steps while CausVid v2 can be refined with increased steps
1.3B is better, faster, considerably less resource intensive for upscaling. Haven't been able to get same details with 14B without high denoise that changes source video
Q8 GGUF will look better than fp8, Q6 will have next to no difference, Q5 and Q4 are good, Q3 sucks
Native with GGUFs is necessary for 12GB VRAM. For 24GB+ wrapper is preferred for anything that isn't VACE or basic I2V/T2V
LightX2V has better detail and image resemblance but kills motion, CausVid + AccVid has 5x better motion but degrades output
Self-forcing 1.3B model has more realistic motion speed than 14B LightX2V
FlowMatch more stable but less natural skin, DPM++_SDE/Beta more realistic/natural looking

comparisons.comparison: Sage Attention 2 Plus speed boost on RTX 5090
comparisons.verdict: Not statistically significant speed boost, sometimes same or slower generation times
Hard to beat Topaz, especially with two-step process using Gaia for upscale and Iris for cleanup
Normal I2V is pretty useless, works fine with control like VACE, UniAnimate or MultiTalk

tips.context: When MMAudio adds unwanted vocal sounds

tips.context: For 60 second video: 60s * 25fps = 1500 frames, but use 1501 frames

tips.tip: Add 'neutral facial expression' to prompt to reduce unwanted mouth movement
tips.context: When trying to prevent constant talking/mouth movement in generated videos

tips.tip: Use closed mouth image and non-expressive face for I2V
tips.context: To prevent mouths from constantly trying to talk in image-to-video generation

tips.tip: Can use prompt scheduling with timestep syntax
tips.context: Format: [0s: description] [5s-10s: description] for different parts of video

tips.tip: Add silence before audio and trim first frames to avoid flash
tips.context: Solution for initial flash problem in lip-sync videos

tips.tip: Use NAG negative prompts: 'talking, speaking, speak, talk, yelling, yell'
tips.context: To prevent unwanted mouth movement in video generation

tips.tip: Use NAG sparingly for targeted changes
tips.context: NAG operates at conceptual level and affects entire composition, so be specific in positive prompt and keep NAG minimal for hair color changes only

tips.tip: Test base model before adding LoRAs
tips.context: When troubleshooting issues like flux face/chin problems, isolate by testing base model first

tips.tip: Use low CFG with high NAG influence
tips.context: CFG 1 with NAG turned up steers very hard away from keywords

tips.tip: Use LightX2V as primary acceleration LoRA
tips.context: Can switch from 8 steps FusionX workflow to 4 steps with custom mix using LightX2V

tips.tip: Use Audacity to convert audio to 44.1khz for better MultiTalk sync
tips.context: When preparing audio files for MultiTalk lip sync

tips.tip: Record phone camera movement for Uni3C instead of 3D rendering
tips.context: For more organic, handheld camera movement in videos

tips.tip: Remove first frame from VACE morph videos
tips.context: First frame often looks weird in VACE morphing workflows

tips.tip: Use strength 0.3 for Uni3C when driving with motion video
tips.context: When feeding movement video into Uni3C for camera control

tips.tip: Use self-forcing with exactly 0.25 strength, not 1.0
tips.context: Otherwise video will be buggy

tips.tip: Remove audio input link in video combine node
tips.context: When you don't want audio from input video

tips.tip: Use empty prompt with random seed for video-to-video
tips.context: Can work better than using original prompt and seed

tips.tip: Use denoise 0.7 for video-to-video
tips.context: Good balance for preserving input while allowing changes

tips.tip: 12-16 images better than 30+ for character LoRA training
tips.context: Overtraining limits range of motion in video

tips.tip: Save videos as H264 MP4 with CRF 2 for quality
tips.context: Instead of WebM or GIF for better quality output

tips.tip: Use ChatGPT to create new prompts from first frame for creative upscaling
tips.context: When doing v2v upscaling for more creative results

tips.tip: Turn off uni3c and context windows for videos under 251 frames
tips.context: Improves performance and reduces restrictions for shorter videos

tips.tip: Include other people/creatures in LoRA training datasets
tips.context: Prevents LoRA bleeding into other objects in the scene

tips.tip: Use smaller shapes with thin borders in VACE
tips.context: Large shapes or thick borders may show up in output

tips.tip: Use ChatGPT to help create prompts from first frame
tips.context: For upscaling workflows, can give ChatGPT a snippet of first frame to help generate appropriate prompts

tips.tip: Lower denoise keeps closer to input video
tips.context: Lower denoise values preserve more of the original video but may bring back pixels/noise depending on input quality

tips.tip: Add padding at start for audio sync
tips.context: Leave padding at the left/start of audio - model needs more time to adapt for better sync

tips.tip: Use 'still camera' prompt for context window issues
tips.context: When using context options with MultiTalk, prompt 'still camera' may help avoid camera movement glitches

tips.tip: Use NAG with MultiTalk for better results
tips.context: Negative words like 'audio out of sync' improve sync quality

tips.tip: Keep denoise low to preserve faces in upscaling
tips.context: Denoise 0.1-0.2 range, higher values will lose faces

tips.tip: Use flowmatch_distill scheduler with distill models
tips.context: Better quality results when using distilled LoRAs

tips.tip: Avoid emotion prompts with MultiTalk
tips.context: Don't add prompts like 'smiling, joyful' as they battle with MultiTalk processing

tips.tip: Use simple prompts like 'high quality video' for upscaling
tips.context: When doing enhancement/upscaling without caring about losing original face

tips.tip: Use solid masks without blur for VACE inpainting
tips.context: When doing character replacement, solid mask without gray fill works better

tips.tip: Split VACE embeds for better control
tips.context: Use separate VACE embeds for different control types (depth, pose, reference)

tips.tip: Reverse video for better SAM2 tracking
tips.context: If subject isn't visible in first frame, reverse video so they appear first, then re-reverse after masking

tips.tip: Use SAM2 keyframes for complex masking
tips.context: Feed multiple frames into SAM2 with different keyframe points to refresh mask info

tips.tip: Low denoise for upscaling
tips.context: Use denoise 0.1-0.2 with UltraWan for polishing/upscaling without changing characters much

tips.tip: Remove pose hands and face for cleaner results
tips.context: When using pose control, disable hands and face detection for better character replacement

tips.tip: Use 3 steps sometimes helps with generation
tips.context: When experimenting with different settings

tips.tip: Turn up audio gain to 3 in Multitalk
tips.context: Helps with audio processing quality

tips.tip: Collapse nodes with Alt+C to manage canvas space
tips.context: Especially useful with Spline Editor nodes that take up lots of space

tips.tip: Use crop and stitch for faces in upscaling
tips.context: When using skip layer guidance workflows

tips.tip: Don't use TeaCache with Light LoRA workflows
tips.context: TeaCache skips steps but Light doesn't have enough steps to skip

tips.tip: 30 fps is sweet spot for Multitalk
tips.context: 60 fps gets too frenetic, good for rapping but not normal speech

tips.tip: Use normal maps for better face/lighting details in VACE
tips.context: When doing video processing with VACE controlnet

tips.tip: Set VACE inputs at 25fps to control motion speed
tips.context: When using VACE for video control

tips.tip: Start with lower denoise values for true upscaling
tips.context: 0.3-0.5 range maintains input video characteristics better than higher values

tips.tip: Use 121 frame context for optimal results
tips.context: Recommended context window size for processing

tips.tip: Use higher context_overlap for longer MultiTalk videos
tips.context: For videos 321+ frames, set context_overlap to around 64 to prevent extra loops

tips.tip: Check console for silent LoRA failures
tips.context: LoRAs can silently fail without UI errors, especially when using wrong model sizes

tips.tip: Use Power LoRA Loader from rgthree for stacking LoRAs
tips.context: Can stack multiple LoRAs on the same node

tips.tip: Lower denoise strength for better likeness in upscaling
tips.context: Drop denoise to around 0.2-0.3 for closer resemblance to original

tips.tip: Add original prompt for upscaling control
tips.context: Can help prevent overly creative changes, though works better without prompt for clean upscale

tips.tip: Search discord channel for 'context stride' to find existing experiments
tips.context: When troubleshooting context window issues

tips.tip: Make LightX2V more dominant when combining speed LoRAs
tips.context: It's the best one by far according to testing

tips.tip: LightX works well for non-realistic looks but loses cinematic realism
tips.context: Choose based on speed vs quality needs

tips.tip: For VACE reference image issues, may be using wrong controlnets
tips.context: Main controlnets (canny, depth, pose) work from start, normals and lineart fail completely

tips.tip: Use SAM2 points editor with VACE for fast masking
tips.context: For video masking and object targeting

tips.tip: Disable MPS or movement loras when using Remade camera loras
tips.context: Remade loras fight with Fusion X loras

tips.tip: Use reference image plugged into VACE Wan Encoder for I2V-like functionality
tips.context: Works well for underlying video passed through controlnet with reference image and prompt

tips.tip: Cancel generation when first frame appears in points editor, set points, then run again
tips.context: Workflow for SAM2 point setting

tips.tip: Offloading to RAM is better than offloading to CPU
tips.context: For systems that must offload model parts

tips.tip: Use spline editor for better camera control than loras
tips.context: Spline method appears to be top choice for camera movement

tips.tip: Use scheduling for LoRAs
tips.context: Try scheduling the lora to be on for last steps but not first steps

tips.tip: Add noise when upscaled video gets too smooth
tips.context: When upscaling results lose fine detail and look too smooth, add noise through the lora or film grain

tips.tip: UltraWan 1K only works well in landscape
tips.context: UltraWan 1K does NOT work well on portrait mode, only landscape videos

tips.tip: Use multiple LoRAs together for 1.3B
tips.context: Use SF DMD FP16 at 0.25, CausVid bidirect2 at 1.0, MPS at 0.25, and UltraWan 1K at 0.25 for best results

tips.tip: Add resolution terms to caption for UltraWan
tips.context: UltraWan was trained in T2V mode, try adding '4k, hdr, high resolution' to caption when using for upscaling

tips.tip: Use distorch loaders from multigpu pack with GGUF files
tips.context: Works similar to blockswap and keeps browser responsive

tips.tip: Don't use full CausVid at 1.0 strength
tips.context: Full CausVid destroys motion, use reduced strength like V2

tips.tip: Use AccVid I2V lora instead of T2V version for image-to-video
tips.context: I2V version is 100 times better and fixes problems with T2V lora

tips.tip: Try rank 16 extraction at higher weight
tips.context: Addresses motion and seed variance concerns with LightX2V

tips.tip: Break long videos into smaller chunks for MultiTalk
tips.context: Cap around 420 frames at a time with 2 second overlap for matching

tips.tip: Use negative prompting (nag) for I2V
tips.context: Very important for image to video generation quality

tips.tip: Prompt I2V differently than T2V
tips.context: Don't use same prompting approach for image to video as text to video

tips.tip: Create video with sound first, then use MultiTalk on second pass
tips.context: Better approach than trying to combine VACE and MultiTalk in single pass

tips.tip: Use detailed motion descriptions for I2V prompts
tips.context: Include specific actions like 'first she places cigarette in mouth, then blows smoke' for better results
